original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down on earnings performance
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Monday, over quarterly earnings possibly showing poor performance, Market Analyst of First Capital Holdings, Ranjan Ranatunga said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was down 0.74 percent or 68.37 points to 9,192.04, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.65 percent or 17.59 points to 2,693.51.

“The sentiment could be down due to earnings reports coming and since the government has implemented reforms based on the International Monetary Fund there are expectations that the earnings reports will look poor compared to last year,” Ranatunga said.
The market generated a poor turnover of 385 million rupees during 1200 hours.
Top losers during mid day trade were Hatton National Bank, Expolanka and Vallibel One. (Colombo/April24/2023)
